definition: silted up/obstructed by silt/variant of 瘀滯|瘀滞[yu1 zhi4]
silt/river sludge/to silt up/choked with silt/variant of 瘀[yu1]

sentences.english: The emphasis is focused on formation of hepatolithiasis stimulated by cholestasis.
sentences.chinese: 重点介绍胆汁淤滞对形成肝内胆管结石的影响。

sentences.english: The one unpardonable sin of nature is to stand still, to stagnate.
sentences.chinese: 自然界最不可饶恕的罪行就是驻足不前，淤滞停止。

sentences.english: This article reports 30 cases of virus hepatitis with intrahepatic cholestasis.
sentences.chinese: 本文报告30例病毒性肝炎伴肝内胆汁淤滞病例。

sentences.english: The stasis in this aneurysm allows mural thrombus, which is present here, to form within the aneurysm.
sentences.chinese: 血液在动脉瘤处淤滞，使得此处形成附壁血栓。

definition: (in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
hematoma (internal blood clot)/extravasated blood (spilt into surrounding tissue)/contusion
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
